Articles.Content:
Hello and Welcome to Quasarr Industries! 

This is just a repository of all the crafts i make to satisfy my sci-fi fix.

Of course i'll be taking requests and partnerships!

I make things REALLY low-part. few of my ships are over 100 parts. This way everyone can enjoy them virtually lag-free!

Anyways, i won't bore you. Onto the ships!

 

Rovers:

Dunarri Mk1     30 parts

It's a simple compact rover meant to quickly rove across planets. I think it's quite pretty.

 

 

Space Battleships:

Neeson Phenix Class Escort     60 parts

A lightly-armoured escort craft for dealing with medium targets. It won't hold up against much punishment, but with 6 heavy missiles, it can do some damage. Also, it can outmatch any ship with a similar part count, GUARANTEED*

 

Lazarus AAMC     180-ish parts

A heavy 130-ton cruiser with fifteen missiles. It has way more parts than i'd like, but it also has actual armour, which most of my other ships don't. Overall, more of a tech demo than an actual battleship, but it could still probably hold its own in a fight.

Also, in my opinion, it just looks cool! 

 

 

Malfunctioning Toasters:

One of Quasarr Industries' quests has been to create a machine to deliver toast to our space stations. Unfortunately we haven't been having much luck...anyway, here's some pretty pictures!

M4-A10 Shuffler     29 parts

With few reliable heat sources and confining 30-part 18-ton hanger available in career mode, making the perfect toaster seemed an impossible task. Turns out, it was! This was our best design, propelled by two fighter jet engines and two mun lander engines, it should have had the perfect consistency of toasting. Unfortunately it ended up taking off vertically and carrying five of our best crew members to orbit, with about 100 delta v remaining, without any docking ports, rcs, or emergency power. at least it didn't stage or break on the way up. Hopefully we can land it horizontally on the runway.

 

HyperKestrel SSTO     60-ish parts

This is our most successful toaster design. Apparently hydrogen running through a nuclear reactor, combined with Rapiers, is quite effective at toasting!  If you store the bread in the cockpit, it gets almost not burnt as the craft flies to orbit. It can even deliver toast to other planets with its 4.4km/s of delta V in orbit! However, sometimes the toast gets really burnt:

That's how we lost our last prototype. Funny story, it kept going until it reached orbit!

 

SR-72 Replica     30-ish parts

The kerbals were sad that "budget deficits" and "public interest" were preventing them from making futuristic awesome spaceships in their favourite game of Human Space Program, so they decided to make them in real life! This is the first of their designs. It's mildly effective at putting burnt toast into orbit.

 

Edited February 18, 2016 by quasarrgames
In response to the random poll, I nominate interplanetary motherships.

Toast is good, but English Muffins are better!

So crunchy and flaky, and with a bit of jam, mmmmm, delicious!

I don't bump very often...

...but when i do, it's because there's a load of new stuff to see.
